text: "Don't Look Back " is a song written by blues singer-songwriter John Lee Hooker and released as a single in 1964. As a duet Hooker performed with Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison, it was a Grammy Award winner in Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals in 1998 from the album, Don't Look Back. ==Song history== This song had a long history with Hooker and Morrison over the years. It was covered by Van Morrison's band Them on their debut album, The Angry Young Them in 1965. The album's sleeve had a comment on the song which read: "John Lee Hooker hailed as one of the greatest R&B; singers in the world wrote 'Don't Look Back'....Perhaps it isn't so extraordinary that this soulful ballad sounds uncannily like a Morrison original as the two men have a lot in common." Them's version was also included in songs hand-picked by Morrison on his second greatest hit album, The Best of Van Morrison Volume Two. A live performance in 1979 was also one of the songs featured on Van Morrison's video Van Morrison in Ireland in 1981.John Lee Hooker – The World´s Greatest Blues Singer Hooker discography retrieved 22 November 2016 ==Cover Versions== * Australian group The Black Sorrows covered the song for their debut studio album, Sonola (1984). ==References== Category:1964 songs Category:1964 singles Category:John Lee Hooker songs Category:Vee-Jay Records singles Category:Van Morrison songs Category:Vocal duets Category:Songs written by John Lee Hooker Category:Grammy Award for Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals
